title: (x) New GM Goodwrench logo - Klavika {Tiff (self)}
content:
For some reason the GM Assets site only has the new logo without the logotype. I thought I knew this one. Can someone identify it? It might be time to get them to license something. Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090416164004im_/http:/typophile.com/files/gmgoodwrench_new_3730.png)
author: Miss Tiffany

comments.content: I’m guessing the ’e’ is a tortured version of whatever typeface this is, as well as, perhaps, the G (although it doesn’t look tortured).

That blue “aquafied” “G” bears a striking resemblance to the Quicktime logo.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090416164004im_/http:/typophile.com/files/quicktime_5106.png)
Yeah we had discussion in the office about how similiar it is to a few logos.
Like the on-off button on my computer, for example. :-) And I bet they paid a lot of money for it — kind of makes one wonder, doesn’t it?
The on/off symbol is way overused. I think I’ve seen it on at least a dozen logos. Time to put it to rest
Yeah, that Goodwrench logo is reminiscent of the Quicktime mark. Actually, I like the simplicity of the on/off button creating the G.
